required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety on Prouk for STEMI Patients in China
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Study to Research the Efficacy and Safety on Prouk for ST Elevated Mycadial Infarction Patients in China

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of rh-prouk as pharmacoinvasive therapy on those ST Elevated Myocardial Infarctions patients, it is designed as a multicenter, active controlled, single blinded study. The primary endpoint is to assess the coronary recanalization 90 minutes after thrombolysis. The secondary endpoint is to evaluate the mortality rate at day 30.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of rh-prouk as pharmacoinvasive therapy on those ST Elevated Myocardial Infarctions patients, it is designed as a multicenter, active controlled, single blinded study. The primary endpoint is to assess percentage of patients achieve the coronary recanalization 90 minutes after thrombolysis. The secondary endpoint is to evaluate the mortality rate at day 30.

primary_outcome.measure: To compare the percentage of STEMI patients achieving the recanalization of Coronary between the two arms

arm_group.description: rhprouk to be administrated in 60 minutes.
The controlled arm patients will be administrated in 90 minutes after randomized.

intervention.description: rh-prouk will be administrated within 60 minutes after the patients eligibility confirmed
